Dr. Faheem Gul Gilal.biography:
Dr. Faheem Gul serves as an Associate Professor of Marketing within the Department of Business Administration at Sukkur IBA University. In addition to this significant role, he also holds the esteemed positions of Director ORIC and Editor-in-Chief of the Sukkur IBA Journal of Management and Business. Dr. Faheem holds an MS and was awarded a Ph.D. with distinction from the School of Economics and Management, University of Science and Technology Beijing in P.R China. 

Dr. Faheem's research interests primarily revolve around consumers' motivation and emotion, with a special emphasis on brand passion, product design techniques, brand experiences, consumer behavior change strategies, CSR brand-fit, cross-cultural gender-specific consumer behavior differences, and self-determination theory. Impressively, Dr. Faheem has an extensive publication record, having published over 60 research papers in SSCI, ABDC, and SCOPUS-listed journals. His research papers have garnered more than 40,000 reads on ResearchGate, and he has received over 2000 citations on Google Scholar, with more than 1000 citations in just the last two years.

Notably, Dr. Faheem received the top-downloaded author award in 2018–2019 and the top-cited author award in 2019-2020 from the Journal of Consumer Behaviour for his pioneering contribution to understanding e-waste disposal behavior. He has been the most popular/downloaded/cited author in the European Management Journal since 2019 for his seminal contribution to introducing a self-determination theory in marketing science as an alternative way of looking at consumer motivation. 

Dr. Faheem's remarkable portfolio as the lead author showcases noteworthy contributions to esteemed journals, including the International Journal of Hospitality Management (ABDC “A Star"), the Journal of Business Research (ABDC A), Psychology & Marketing (ABDC A), the Journal of Consumer Behavior (ABDC A), the Journal of Brand Management (ABDC A), the Journal of Product & Brand Management (ABDC A), the International Journal of Consumer Studies (ABDC A), Business Strategy & Environment (ABDC A), the International Journal of Market Research (ABDC A), and the International Journal of Bank Marketing (ABDC A), among other esteemed journals.

Throughout his academic journey, Dr. Faheem excelled and earned numerous prestigious academic awards, including China’s most esteemed National Award and the Highly Commended Award for his outstanding dissertation in the field of Marketing and Brand Management.

1.institute: University of Science and Technology Beijing (USTB), P.R. China

Farhan Shahzad.biography:
Farhan mainly teach, research and supervise FYP projects of master’s level students related to organizational behavior and human resource management. He is highly passionate about his teaching; he engages students in the learning process using case based method and usually conducts interactive and unconventional sessions. His class activities include role-plays, business simulations, talk shows, live cases and team based activities. He always place students in the center, understand their viewpoints, and encourage them to lead the discussions. 

He has been teaching following courses to undergraduate and graduate level students: Organizational Behavior and Leadership, Business Strategy, Talent Acquisition & Management, Performance Management, HR Analytics, Human Behavior & Social Psychology, Human Resource Management, Comparative Management, Conflict Management, Technology Entrepreneurship etc.

His research interest in mainly inclined towards understanding work behaviors, how they are driven and why they are important to regulate in order to achieve bottom lines. This will help organizations to sustain their operations. Further, he is engaged in writing research based case studies for the case teachers.

Dr. Asad Ali Qazi.biography:
Dr. Qazi has been serving as an Assistant Professor in Supply Chain Management since 2017. He completed his Ph.D. at the University of Rome Tor Vergata in Rome, Italy, focusing his research on identifying the barriers and enablers of circular procurement management within the Italian electrical and electronic equipment supply chain.

In addition to his academic role, Dr. Qazi has made significant contributions to the field of education. He has imparted knowledge in Operations Management at the MBA program at Luiss Business School in Rome. Since 2020, he has been an instructor in Sustainable Supply Chain Management at the University of Rome Tor Vergata as part of their master's program.

Dr. Qazi's commitment to advancing the knowledge base in his field is evident through his presentations at esteemed conferences, including AOM-USA, POMS, IPSERA, and EurOMA. Notably, his paper at AOM-USA 2023 was acknowledged among the top 10% in the Operations and Supply Chain Management division.

With a solid record of publications, Dr. Qazi has authored several research papers and teaching cases in leading journals. His academic journey is complemented by a robust industry background, boasting seven years of experience in Supply Chain Management with distinguished organizations such as English Biscuit Manufacturers, Abu Dawood, and Interwood Mobel.

Dr. Qazi's passion lies in bridging the gap between academia and industry, and his diverse experiences contribute to a holistic understanding of the dynamic field of Supply Chain Management.

Tahir Mahmood.biography:
Dr Tahir Mahmood earned a Ph.D. in Economics from the Georg August University Goettingen, Germany in 2018 and a Postdoctoral Fellowship at the multidisciplinary KIP Project in the Olayan School of Business at the American University of Beirut in 2020. He has completed his MSc and MPhil from QAU Islamabad and Graduation from GC University Lahore. 
Currently, he is working as an Assistant Professor-Economics, at the Faculty of Business Administration, Sukkur IBA University, Pakistan. Dr Tahir is a Higher Education Commission (HEC) Pakistan-approved PhD supervisor. Before, joining SIBAU, he remained a faculty member at Abdul Wali Khan University Mardan, the University of Chitral, COMSATS Abbottabad and FG Quaid-E-Azam Degree College Rawalpindi. 
Dr. Tahir has almost ten years of teaching and research experience at national and international organizations and universities. During his Post-doctorate fellowship, he led the quantitative component of the KIP Project: developing an indigenous Women's Economic Empowerment Index the so-called KIP Index for the MENA economies. Furthermore, he was a scientific researcher for one and half years in the Project “AgreeCareerNet: Georg August University, Goettingen”, where my duty was to design a course for master students entitled “Agribusiness in Asia”. Moreover, Dr Tahir has vast experience in using STATA at an advanced level and peer-reviewed publications in international journals. His research areas are Development Economics, Public Health, Behavioral Economics, Applied Micro econometrics and Health Economics.

Masroor Ali Soomro.biography:
Meet Mr. Masroor Ali Soomro, a passionate and dynamic professional in the field of Management and HR. Currently working as a full-time permanent Senior faculty member for HR & OB at Sukkur IBA University. He is also a professional corporate training consultant offering his expertise in soft skills, technical skills, and HR training consultancy services. With a keen interest in time management, stress management, conflict management, change management, attitude management, leadership, decision making, behavioral modeling, and employee performance management, Mr. Soomro is a go-to person for all your professional training needs.

Mr. Soomro's academic qualifications are impressive and showcase his dedication towards learning and growth. He holds a Master's degree in Business Administration (MBA) with a specialization in Human Resource Management from IQRA University Main Campus Karachi, and an equivalency in Master of Philosophy in HRM from Higher Education Commission (HEC) Pakistan. In addition to this, he has completed several diplomas in management sciences and information technology from SZABIST and Sindh Board of Technical Education Karachi, Pakistan.

A researcher with interests in digital HRM, innovation HRM, transformational leadership, AI in HRM, and sustainable/green HRM. Your research explores the potential of technology and innovative practices to transform HRM practices and enhance employee performance and well-being. He is also interested in the potential of AI to automate and improve HR processes, and in exploring sustainable HRM practices that align with environmental concerns. Overall, his research seeks to create positive change in HRM practices for the benefit of employees, organizations, and the environment

With his expertise and experience, Mr. Soomro has also served as an external associate trainer consultant for Sui Southern Gas Company Limited (SSGCL), the pioneering gas company of Pakistan in the energy sector. 

Mr. Soomro's teaching methodology is innovative and engaging, focusing on participative learning in class where students contribute to course content. He uses role-plays, movies, multimedia presentations, cases, and simulations to make his lectures more interactive and effective. 

Furthermore, his professional certifications from Macquarie University, Sydney, Australia, University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign, University of Michigan - Stephen M. Ross School of Business, and University of Minnesota - Carlson School of Management, showcase his commitment towards continued professional development and growth.

With his vast knowledge and experience, he can help you achieve your professional goals and take your career to new heights.

Dr. Saleem is a faculty member of Business-related Laws at Sukkur IBA University and an advocate on roll of Sindh Bar Council. He holds LLB; LLM and PhD in Law with an expertise on legal research in Administrative-Criminal law especially related to Money Laundering (ML) and financial crime; he possesses relevant research skills required to take research project which involve criminal law theories in property system, corporate liability concepts and regulatory regimes.

Apart from this he possesses specialty in corporate laws, and conducts case study sessions on Legal and Regulatory Environment of Business. Further, Dr. Saleem has ability of relating his knowledge of Law and History to real world of science and society. He is an active member and coordinator of British Council’s Active Citizens Facilitators at Sukkur IBA and conducted much training on Community and active citizenship, besides this he works with center for entrepreneurship on “Social Enterprise.”

Syed Mohsin Kazmi(SL).biography:
Mr. Kazmi studies human resource planning and execution. His current interest focuses more on Entrepreneurship - Chinese Business Practices from an international trade perspective. Mr. Kazmi is an effective case study writer and is one of the pioneering case study instructors at Sukkur IBA.                                                                                                                            

His research emphasis more on Entrepreneurship, Change Management, Human Resource Management, Leadership and Motivation.                                                                                                                

His curiosity in teaching brings more fun and creativity during his lectures, He concentrates more on participant-centered learning using role-plays, movies, cases and simulations.                                                                                          

Mr. Kazmi also work as a corporate trainer and consultant on various matters of Human Resource Management and Leadership. He has conducted several in-house and out-house training sessions for both Private and Public clients.                                                                                                   

Mr. Kazmi has recently finished his academic tour from China, where he developed cross cultural understanding and global entrepreneurial skills. There he worked closely with the top management of ICBC Head Office in Beijing and has done various academic projects with leading Chinese companies like SinoPec, CFDA, Danfoss, China Coal and mining company and Thai Airways(China).

1.institute: Sukkur Institute of Business Administration, Sukkur Pakistan

2.institute: University of International Business and Economics, Beijing CHINA

Dr. Nabeel Nisar.biography: I am passionate about engaging customers, particularly alumni, with their alma mater for long-term organizational success. I have published research in the leading peer-reviewed academic journals in alumni engagement, philanthropy, volunteering as an active citizen, customer engagement, and customer experiences. I bring over 14 years of experience as a real-time marketer, research scholar, case study writer, entrepreneur, trainer, and marketing & management strategy consultant. I am currently employed at Sukkur IBA as an Assistant Professor of Marketing. I am serving as the Lead Instructor of the National Academy of Higher Education (NAHE), Higher Education Commission to implement the Undergraduate Education Policy 2020, and an International Labor Organization-certified trainer on business startups and entrepreneurship in Pakistan. Additionally, I am an ATLAS.ti certified trainer, encouraging and training individuals on how to use ATLAS.ti to conduct qualitative research effectively. Before joining Sukkur IBA, I worked for KFC Pakistan in various services marketing, customer engagement, CSR, institutional development, and sustainability capacities. Qualitative research, marketing strategy, consumer interaction, alumni relationship, institutional advancement, relationship marketing, organizational sustainability particularly of public HEIs, and social enterprise development are my areas of interest.

Mr Saeed Abbas Shah.biography: Saeed Abbas is specialised in the field of Marketing. He teaches different marketing courses i.e. Strategic Marketing Management, Brand Management, Advertising Management and Services Marketing.

Abdul Khaliq Daudpota.biography:
Mr.Abdul Khaliq teaches specialization and advance course of Finance in MBA and MS programs. His area of interest are teaching investment courses such as Security Analysis, Finance Derivatives, Fixed Income Securities,etc. 
He is the first position-holder graduate from IBA Karachi in BBA and MBA programs. He holds CFA Charter. 
In addition to teaching, He has been involved in supervising as faculty consultant MBA projects.
He is a liaison person with AACSB and involved in implementing Assurance Learning Process as well as in NBEAC accreditation.  

He is also actively involved in writing teaching case-studies.

Dr. Javed Ali.biography: Dr. Javed Ali Tunio is Doctor of Philosophy in Marketing. Dr. Tunio has been serving Sukkur IBA University since 2015. His research interests include services marketing, service quality, healthcare services, bibliometric analysis and social marketing.

Dr. Raja Shahzad Shaikh.biography: Mr Raja Shahzad is associated with Sukkur IBA University for the last twelve years. He is currently working as Assistant Professor (Finance and Accounting) in Business Department. He teaches Portfolio Management, Strategic Financial Management, International Economics and Finance, Financial Management and Financial Accounting. Dr Raja Shahzad recently completed his PhD in Finance at one of the top 100 and triple accredited  Durham University in the United Kingdom.  His thesis includes a computational content analysis of Central Bank Monetary Policy Meeting Minutes. More specifically his research interest includes analysis of the impact of the central bank's optimistic (pessimistic) tone on investor sentiment, risk assessment, risk tolerance and trading behaviour in financial markets. His area of research also includes monetary policy, central bank communications, investor sentiments, trading behaviour and risk aversion. Before his PhD, he completed his MSc. Accounting and Finance from Durham University and MBA Finance at Sukkur IBA.

5.degree: Course on Post Crises: What is next for global financial and monetary system

Amir Ali Khan Ghouri.biography:
Mr Ghouri belongs to a family which has been in business for the last six generations. He is the
current Executive Director of Ghouri’s group of companies.
He has remained an active participant towards educational progress of Sindh in general and
towards Business management studies in particular. Aamir is Sukkur IBA’s first ever Professor of
Practice.
Aamir has also served previously many times on the Sukkur Chamber of Commerce and Industry’s
Executive Committee and Standing Committees, and has a vast experience in dealing with many
Government Ministries and Departments concerned with Business. He has recently served as the
President of Sukkur Chamber of Commerce and Industry.

Pro. Dr. Sarwar M. Azhar.biography:
Dr Sarwar M Azhar has over 35 years of combined experience as a practising business manager and
as an academician in the field of management and marketing. He started his family business in
1983, which included Pak American Institute of Management Sciences, a higher educational
institute offering graduate and post graduate degrees in Management and Computer Sciences. He
also launched Pamir Knot College providing education at the primary and secondary level. In 1998,
he left to do his PhD at Nottingham University Business School, Nottingham UK. He has published
over 30 research papers in both national and international journals. A book titled “Globalization”,
edited by him, has also been published.

Dr. Manzoor Ali Mirani.biography:
Student-centered Professor with expertise in Entrepreneurship and Management. Offering 21 years background in supporting students, developing undergraduate and graduate courses, supervising projects and theses. Consistently striving for excellence of academic environment to produce marketable graduates and achieving academic goals. Dr. Mirani graduated with a PhD in Management from Universiti Tun Abdul Razak Malaysia. He has widely published in both national and international journals.
Dr. Mirani has also served on various academic leadership positions like Program Coordinator for graduate programs, undergraduate programs, and foundation programs. 
Dr. Mirani has been part of entrepreneurship development programs like Global Entrepreneurship Monitor (GEM) Malaysia, SMEDA and Engro Foundation Programs on the platform of SUKKUR IBA. 
Additionally, Dr. Mirani also has rich boardroom experience of serving on Board of Governors Sukkur IBA, and Senate of Sukkur IBA, Academic Council of Sukkur IBA University. Currently he is member of Board of Studies, Institute of Commerce University of Sindh Jamshoro, and Department of Public Administration Shah Abdul Latif University Khairpur, and Department of Management Sciences & Technology, BNB Women University Sukkur.

Research Areas: Entrepreneurship, Academic Entrepreneurship, Entrepreneurial Universities, Strategic Management, HR Practices

Dr. Khalil Ahmed Channa.biography: Dr Khalil A Channa is serving as Associate Professor at Sukkur IBA University. Before taking this position, Dr Channa earned his PhD from University of Edinburgh, in the area of international HRM. He has double Masters: Masters in Research and Philosophies in Management from Lancaster University, United Kingdom and MBA from IBA. He has served as faculty member at Sukkur IBA, Lancaster and Edinburgh University in the field of HRM.  He enjoys wide experience of teaching, research, training and development. He has been corporate trainers and consultant, lead trainer to UNDP, HEC,, and other national & international institutions and organisations. Dr Channa has widely published in ABDC A category, ABS, HEC recognised journals and multiple other top indexed journals. Dr Channa has served as cluster head of Management science group, member of academic council, and program director of BBA, MBA, and MS-PhD program at Sukkur IBA University. He has successfully supervised 3 PhD scholars and 15 MS/MPhil scholars as HEC approved supervisor. Dr Channa has professional affiliation with multiple academic and professional organisations such as CIPD UK, Academy of Management, University of Edinburgh, SHRM, USA.

5.institute: Institute Kojadi, Malasyia/ Wigan and Leigh College,UK

Noor A. Khoso.biography:
A young, enthusiastic and self-motivated person, Mr. Khoso has completed Master of Science in Economics from Quiad-i-Azam University, Islamabad. He believes that the only thing which can change the socio-economic situation of any economy is quality education. Realizing this gap and motivated by his inspiring teachers, Mr. Khoso chose teaching as his career. 
 
He has been engaged with teaching undergraduates and graduates since 2013. Currently he is teaching Development Economics and Issues in Pakistan’s Economy and his research interests are poverty, inequality and health economics.

Dr. Mujeeb-u-Rehman Bhayo.biography: Dr. Bhayo did his PhD in the area of asset pricing. His research interests include financial Economics, especially in Asset pricing and cross-section of expected stock returns, empirical finance, and financial markets. His teaching interests include, financial markets, investment and portfolio management, and financial econometrics.

2.degree: Diploma in Social Sciences Research Methods (SSRM)

Dr. Agha Jahanzeb.biography: Dr. Agha Jahanzeb works as an Assistant Professor at Sukkur IBA University. His research interest includes Corporate Finance, Financial Management and Debt Financing. He has designed course modules for teaching and training on Financial Management, Corporate Finance, Business Research Methodology and Investment Banking. He has attended and conducted professional training for academicians in Malaysia and at Sukkur IBA. His training portfolio falls in different areas that include statistical software (i.e. SPSS, STATA and Eviews), Panel Data and Time Series Analyses, Thesis Writing, Plagiarism and Role of Moderator and Mediator in Research. He has also served as a reviewer for Journal of Social Science Studies and as an ad-hoc reviewer for some Emerald Journals. His research work has been published in several international peer-reviewed journals, i.e. Cogent Economics & Finance, Science International, Research Journal of Applied Sciences, Engineering and Technology, International Journal of Information Processing and Management, Middle-East Journal of Scientific Research, International Journal of Management and Commerce Innovation, and Actual Problems of Economics.

Dr. Sarfraz Ahmed Dakhan.biography:
Dr. Sarfraz Ahmed is one of our senior faculty members. His area of research include, gender-based entrepreneurship, entrepreneurial intentions motivations and cultural influences. Mr. Dakhan has published in various reputable national and international journals including two book chapters.
Mr. Dakhan is elected member of Syndicate. Currently, He is also serving as Provost Hostels.

Dr. Altaf Hussain Samo.biography:
Altaf Hussain has over 20 years of experience in consulting, project management, education, training, and research in the fields of entrepreneurship, skill development, youth empowerment, and rural development.  Altaf Hussain is a leading changemaker in the fields of entrepreneurship, skill development, youth empowerment, and rural development. The ECO Entrepreneurship program developed by Dr. Altaf  was recognized  byUN Academic Impact initiative program  in 2024.
https://www.un.org/en/academic-impact/university-pakistan-develops-eco-entrepreneurship-program-symphony-sustainable-hope 
 He holds a PhD in Entrepreneurship, a MIT Teaching Fellow credential, a THINC Fellowship, and a Global Goodwill Ambassador recognition for his work and vision.
As the Director of Executive Development Center (EDC) at Sukkur IBA University, an AACSB accredited institution, he leads the design and management of various programs that aim to enhance the employability, productivity, and innovation of the participants, especially in rural areas of Pakistan. He has trained more than 15,000 people and conducted several webinars that reached over 200,000 viewers on the EDC platform. He has also worked on several projects as a team lead, project lead, consultant, researcher, key expert, country head, director, and advisor with national and international organizations such as UNICEF, Commonwealth Secretariat, British Council, USAID, and State Bank of Pakistan. He is passionate and visionary about creating and supporting opportunities for learning, growth, and social impact.

Prof. Dr. Niaz Ahmed Bhutto.biography:
Dr. Niaz Ahmed Bhutto is currently Professor of Economics in Business Administration Department at Sukkur Institute of Business Administration University Sindh. He was the head of the Business Administration Department for more than seven years. He also worked on various administrative positions to advance the mission of the university. He did his Post-Doctorate from Edward J. Bloustein School of Planning and Public Policy, Rutgers the State University of New Jersey USA in 2013 under Fulbright Scholarship Program. He did his PhD in Economics from Hacettepe University Ankara, Turkey in 2007. He topped the Faculty of Arts in Bachelors and Masters and was awarded two times the gold medal by Shah Abdul Latif University Khairpur.
He organized many national and international research conferences at Sukkur IBA. He is the approved supervisor for PhD and MS by Higher Education Commission of Pakistan & he is research fellow in Policy Analysis and Modeling Group Turkey. He was awarded Best University Teachers Award for the year 2010 by HEC.
Dr. Niaz Ahmed Bhutto has more than 23 years of teaching and research experience.  He has published many articles in reputable journals and presented papers in international and national conferences. His areas of interest are: Game Theory, Input-Output Economics, Sustainable Development, and International Trade and Finance

2.institute: Edward J Bloustein School of planning and Public Policy, Rutgers the State University of New Jersey, USA

Dr. Khalid Ahmed.biography:
Dr. Khalid Ahmed is currently serving as an Associate Professor of Economics at the department
of Business administration, Sukkur IBA University. His area of interest falls within Applied
Economics with focus on sustainable development. He has also served as the Director, Office of
Research, Innovation and Commercialization (ORIC) prior to his departure for Post-doctorate at
the university of Cambridge and university of Gottingen, which was jointly funded by Charles
Wallace Foundation U.K and Erasmus Mundus European commission in 2015. Dr. Khalid
received his PhD in Economics from the Wuhan University of Technology P.R China in 2013
and has been Visiting Fellow at the Korea Institute for International Economic Policy (KIEP),
South Korea in 2014. He has been a research fellow at the Energy Policy Research Group
(EPRG) at Judge Business School, University and Cambridge; and visiting fellow at the
department of Economics, Monash University in 2018. In addition, Dr. Khalid has managed two
thematic research grants funded by Higher Education Commission of Pakistan as principal
investigator and one as the co-principal investigator. He is also the founder of Behavioral Lab at
Sukkur IBA University.

1.institute: Wuhan University of Technology, P.R China

Shakil Ahmed Jiskani.biography: Engr. Shakil Ahmed Jiskani is currently working as a Lecturer (Energy Systems Engineering) in the Department of Electrical Engineering at Sukkur IBA University. His area of expertise is Renewable Energy, water & wastewater treatment, waste to energy. He has more than 5 years of teaching & research experience at the university level.

Qasim Ali.biography: Dr. Qasim Ali is teaching at the Department of Electrical Engineering, Sukkur IBA University from January 2020. Before that he was part of COMSATS University. He has done is PhD from Hanyang University South Korea. His field of research is Electrical Machine Design and Control.

Dr. Abdul Raheem.biography: Dr. Abdul Raheem has earned his B.E. in Energy & Environment Engineering from the Quaid-e-Awam University of Engineering Science & Technology Nawabshah in 2013. After that Dr. Raheem moved to Malaysia to pursue his Master's degree from Universiti Putra Malaysia in 2016. Soon after, he received his Ph.D. in Environmental Science & Engineering from the Tsinghua University in 2020, working under the supervision of Professor Ming Zhao. His thesis work was centered around the heterogeneous catalytic conversion of algae-biomass conversion via gasification to produce fuels and specialty chemicals. Dr. Raheem joined the East China University of Science and Technology, Shanghai China as a postdoctoral fellow. His current research focuses on thermochemical conversion (i.e,. pyrolysis, sorption-enhanced catalytic steam reforming, chemical looping steam reforming, auto-thermal gasification) of bio-waste (e.g., crop residues, food waste, animal waste, etc.)  into variety of biofuels.

Prof. Syed Mir Muhammad Shah.biography: Dr Mir Muhammad Shah served as an Acting Vice Chancellor of Sukkur IBA University and honorary Professor of HRM in the Department of Business Administration. He completed his Master of Science from Szabist Karachi and Ph.D. from Universiti Utara Malaysia (UUM), majoring both in the field of Human Resource Management.

Dr. Hafiz Mudassir Munir.biography: afiz Mudassir Munir received his B.S. degree in Electrical Engineering from the University of Engineering and Technology, Lahore, Pakistan, in 2009; his M.S. degree in Electrical Power Engineering from the University of Greenwich, London, ENG, UK, in 2012; his Ph.D. degree in Electrical Engineering from the University of Electronic Sciences and Technology of China (UESTC), China. Currently, he is working as an Assistant Professor at Sukkur IBA University, Pakistan. His research interests include AC/DC microgrid, Power Quality, Distributed Generation, Power Converters, Power Systems Analysis, Renewable Energy Technologies, Hybrid Systems, Photovoltaic Systems, Harmonics Filter design and HVDC. He has published numerous articles and papers in various high-ranked journals including the Journal of Power Electronics, Sustainability, IEEE Access, IEEE Journal of Emerging and Selected Topics in Power Electronics, Energy Reports, and Scientific Reports.

3.institute: University of Electronic Science and Technology of China

Shoaib Ahmed Shaikh.biography: Mr. Shoaib Ahmed Shaikh having M.E (Electrical Power System) from NED University Karachi and B.E(Electrical Power Engineering) from QUEST N/Shah is currently working as Lecturer at Sukkur IBA University. He started his career from February 2013 as a Junior Engineer at Pak Oasis Industries Pvt. (Ltd.) Karachi and worked for three years. After resigning from this industrial job,he moved to Academic field where he started working as Lab Engineer/Lecturer at different universities (Indus, Preston and Hamdard) Karachi.His area of interest includes: Electrical Power Distribution system, Power System Protection, Energy Conservation and Renewable Energy System.

Dr. Ahmed Ali Shah.biography:
Dr. Ahmed Ali Shah  completed bachelor of engineering (B.E) degree from Mehran
university of engineering and technology Jamshoro in electronic engineering. He was
awarded prestigious Higher Education Commission (HEC) Pakistan fully funded HRDI-
UET/USTPs scheme scholarship, for MS leading to PhD studies from Hanyang University’s
Education Research Industry Cluster Ansan (E.R.I.C.A ) campus, South Korea. Over the past
few years, Dr. Shah have participated in number of industrial projects and received various
technical trainings and certifications. He has hands on experience in soft fabrication of
photonics based sensing and imaging nano platforms, specifically his focus was to improve the
limit of detection values (LODs), that in turn enhances sensitivity and minimizes safety risks.
His areas of interest include, surface enhanced Raman scattering (SERS), electric field
responsive nano structures, graphene, organic electronics, electro hydrodynamic co-jetting, and
kinky nanowires. Briefly to date his research work has been disseminated to international
audiences, in the form of patents, SCI research journals papers, and peer reviewed international
conference proceedings.

Fida Hussain Memon.biography:
Dr Fida Hussain is associated with Sukkur IBA University since 2014 and currently he is working as Assistant Professor in the deaprtment of Electrical Engineering. He did his PhD in Micro Mechatronics from Jeju National University, Republic of South Korea with more than 40 impact factor publications in reputable research journals.

Dr Fida did his bachelor of Engineering in Electronics (2011) and Master of Engineering in Communication Systems and Networks (2016) from Mehran University of Engineering and Technology, Jamshoro. He has been teaching various courses like Analog and Digital Communication, Digital Logic Design, Embedded Systems, Electronic circuits and designs and Applied Physics in Electrical Enginnering Department. 

In 2017, Dr Fida qualified Fab Lab Diploma from center of BIts and Atoms, MIT, USA and became one of the first four Fab Lab Diploma holders in Pakistan. He is founding member of the first ever fabrication lab in Pakistan. He also holds the status of global Fab Lab instructor for two years and from 2019 to 2020 Dr Fida was Manager Fab Labs at Sukkur IBA University.

Currently He is working on Sensor Integration for Biomedical testing system Platforms and His areas of research are Digital Fabrication, Soft Robotics, Sensor Integration for Microphysiological Systems and Membrane Technology for water purification.

Dr. Afaque Manzoor Soomro.biography:
Dr. Afaque Manzoor is an Assistant Professor in the Electrical Engineering Department at Sukkur IBA University and leads the AMMEL Lab-Laboratory Advanced Micro Mechatronics and Energy Lab. 
Dr. Afaque received his Ph.D. in Mechatronics Engineering and soft Robotics from the Jeju National University (JNU) and then worked as a Senior Research fellow in the same lab. He also taught a module on Advanced Printed Electronics to Postgraduate students at JNU. His research interests are primarily in soft (active) materials, soft robotics, emerging electronics, wearable health monitoring, and 3D/4D printing of multifunctional materials. He has authored over 35 research papers in SCI/SCIE IF international journals. He is currently serving as Academic Editor for the Journal of Robotics (IF 1.8), Editorial Board Member for  AI, Computer Science and Robotics Technology, and Guest Editor for Frontiers in Electronics
 

Research Interests 

Soft (active) Materials, Metamaterials, Bioinspired materials, Multifunctional composites, Programmable materials, Smart materials & structures

Dr. Khawaja Haider Ali.biography:
In addition to his distinguished career in the fields of Electrical, Electronics, and Renewable Energy Engineering, Dr. Haider is a prominent figure in the field of cutting-edge research and education. He obtained a PhD in Renewable Energy Engineering from the University of Exeter (Russel group), specializing in the optimization of Microgrids through Artificial Intelligence techniques.

His academic career began with a Bachelor of Science degree in Electronics Engineering at BZU Multan. Providing the foundation for a Master's degree in Electrical Engineering obtained in Germany. The foundational studies he completed provided him with a strong technical background in the field of electrical and electronic engineering.

Over the course of his professional career, Dr. Haider has accumulated over 11 years of valuable experience in both teaching and research. As a result of his dedication to education, he has had a positive impact on the lives of countless students, and his contributions to research have been widely recognized worldwide. Over the years, he has authored and published more than ten articles in both national and international journals, with many of those journals boasting impressive impact factors.

A hallmark of Dr. Haider's distinguished career has been his commitment to mentoring and guidance. Numerous of his students have achieved national and international recognition through research grants and scholarships after he has supervised their final year projects. This exemplifies his passion for nurturing the next generation of engineers and researchers.

Dr. Haider's multifaceted expertise, spanning electrical, electronics, and renewable energy engineering, coupled with his groundbreaking work in Microgrid optimization using Artificial Intelligence, has positioned him as a trailblazer in the industry. His unwavering dedication to education and research continues to shape the future of engineering and renewable energy, making him a true luminary in the field.

Shairoz Ismail.biography:
Shairoz Ismail has done her Master of Education (M.Ed) in TeacherEducation and Advanced Diploma in School Management (ADISM) from the Aga Khan University –Institute for Educational Development Pakistan (AKU-IEDP). She has also done her Diploma in Montessori. She has done the Aga Khan Development Network Science of Early Child Development (AKDN SECD) online course from the Red River College of Applied Arts, Science and Technology Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada.

As an Academic advisor for Early Childhood Development (ECD) at the Education Office, South (Regional Office) of the Aga Khan Education Service, Pakistan (AKES, P) she has designed and taught the ECD Certificate Course for the teachers of AKES, P and other school systems ofSindh andPunjab. In addition, she has facilitated various training workshops for the ECD teachers of AKES, P. She has contributed in the development and enrichment of ECD Curriculum as well as has edited the textbooks for young children.

She has led the initiative of launching the Early Years Program for 2 to 3 years old children and designed a curriculum to be offered in one of the Aga Khan schools in Karachi. She has also done the online tutoring in the AKDN SECD course jointly offered by the AKDN and the Red River College of Applied Arts, Science and Technology Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada.

Her academic writings also got published in the national and international journals/magazines. Moreover, she has got several years of teaching and school leadership experience at Montessori, primary and lower secondary level in which she has worked in different capacities such as Classroom teacher, Course- Coordinator, Deputy Head teacher, Learning Area Coordinator, Academic Coordinator and Vice Principal.

She has also worked as Head teacher of senior section (Grade VIII, IX and X) in Sultan Mohamed Shah Aga Khan School Karachi. During her leadership it was the first time in its history that the school secured a 1stposition across Pakistan besides acquired several other academic positions in the SSC Examination 2011 held by the Aga Khan University Examination Board. Recently she has joined Sukkur Institute of Business Administration (SIBA) as Lecturer in Education where her work scope includes teaching in the Department of Education as well as strengthening the Early Childhood Education Programs of SIBA Community Colleges and the Public Schools managed by SIBA.

Dr. AL Karim Datoo.biography:
I am a sociologist of education and a trained educational ethnographer. I have over a decade of experience in teaching and developing higher education contexts in the UK and Pakistan. I actively draw upon my extensive research experience to orient and frame my pedagogy, especially, paying special attention to cultural capital that learners bring to the classrooms and/or zoom-rooms, their interests, and aspirations which I use as ‘starters’ and ‘connectors’ to pitch my instructional and assessment for learning strategies in line with the desired learning objectives.

My academic and professional practice (including international educational consultancy work) revolves around domains of policy sociology (analyzing education policy through a lens of SDG-4), educational evaluation, and curriculum development (primary, secondary and tertiary levels), and teacher education in the global south. The main areas of my research, teaching, and research supervision include globalization and curriculum nexus, curriculum analysis (through SDG-4 lens), ethnography, and teacher development (pre-service and in-service).

I bring rich experience and insights gained from working across academia, public sector, third sector, and culturally diverse community contexts; which enables me to synergize collaborations and partnerships across international and national development partners (including policymakers and international donor agencies).
One of the highlights of my research career so far is multi-site research (which I led as a PI) examining the impact of globalization on the formation of youth values and identities (diaspora in the West, and in countries of the global south), got disseminated in twenty-one countries across North America, Europe, Australia & New Zealand, Far East, South East, Central Asia & Africa (between 2016-20180. This particular research attracted policy attention (at the Board of Governors level) advocating inclusive and culturally relevant education and social development policies and interventions to counter increasing alienation and marginalized of disadvantaged youth (through nexus of poverty, gender, and social class), in both contexts of the global north and global south.

I have been invited as an expert on several national-level curriculum review committees (Social Studies, National Curriculum) by the Ministry of Education, Pakistan. In 2014, I was also invited as a guest panelist speaker in an international conference organized by the Ministry of Culture and Education, France.

Dr. Ali Nawab.biography: Dr Ali Nawab has around 16 years experience of working with renowned national and international organizations and institutes in various capacities such as Faculty at Aga Khan University, Teacher Educator at Aga Khan Education Service, Principal at Army Public School and IBA Public School and Academic Teacher at Flinders University South Australia. Working in these capacities, Dr Ali Nawab has vast experience of designing and implementing capacity building programs for teachers and schools, leading and managing educational institutes, evaluating management and teaching practices in schools as external evaluator, teaching young and adult learners and supervising research projects of students. He has been awarded with Distinction Award in Research as well as Outstanding Teacher Award by Aga Khan University and Horizon Award by Flinders University, Australia in recognition of continuing professional development. Dr Nawab has published numerous articles in peer reviewed international journals as well as book chapters. He is also working as an Associate Editor with a local education journal and as a reviewer with many international journals. His research interest include professional learning, organizational learning, school improvement and educational leadership and management.

Engr. Prof. Dr. Madad Ali Shah.biography:
I achieved my PhD from System Engineering Department, Brunel University, Uxbridge, UK in the area of Electrical and Electronics Engineering. In my PhD, I designed a hand-held unit to simultaneously communicate with Electronic compass, Mobile telephone and GPS receiver. This project was co-sponsored by RNIB (Royal National Institute for Blind) UK and the designed unit was proposed for the guidance of blind and partially sighted pedestrians.

I published 57 research articles in International and HEC-recognized national journals. My 2 articles are under revisions and 1 Book and 2 Book chapters (considered equal to research journal publications by HEC) are also published by renowned publishers. I also presented 20 research papers at International forums & got them published in conference proceedings. 

After completion of my Bachelors in Computer Systems Engineering with 1st class and 1st position from Mehran University of Engineering & Technology (MUET), I have 31+ years’ experience at various administrative and academic positions including the Benazir Bhutto Shaheed University of Technology and Skill Development (BBSUTSD) Khairpur Mirs, Sukkur IBA University, West London College of Business & Management Sciences (WLCBMS), West London School of Management & Technology, Wireless Wizards Limited (WLSMT), International Management & Recruitment Consultants (IMRC) Ltd, Brunel University, University of Plymouth, Pakistan Telecommunication Company limited, Water & Power Development Authority and Shah Abdul Latif University Khairpur Mirs.

My total administrative experience at senior and administrative positions is more than 20 years including 5 years and 7 months as Vice Chancellor of the Benazir Bhutto Shaheed University of Technology and Skill Development Khairpur Mirs, about 10 years as Head of Electrical and Telecom Engineering, Head of International Linkages Programme and Head of Disciplinary Action Committee with Sukkur IBA University, 6 months as Senior Lecturer and Head of Computing Department with WLCBMS, 1 year and 5 months as Senior lecturer and Head of Information Technology and Telecom Engineering Department with WLSMT and 1 year and 1 month as Head of Department of Computer Science and IT with IMRC, London (Please see the attached CV and certificates).

Having professional experience in Institutional Accreditation, Curriculum Design and Development, Satellite Navigation Engineering, Digital Coding, & Computer Security, I researched, planned, implemented, managed, taught and recommended new tools and technologies in the areas of Mobile & Satellite communications, Computer Systems, Electronics & Telecommunication Engineering, Information & Communication Technologies, E-Business and the development of a soft GPS Satellite IP module.

Dedicated to achieve my targets, I fulfil my responsibilities with firm commitment. I have been awarded “Best University Teacher’s Award” twice in 2009 and 2015 from Higher Education Commission, Pakistan and two Gold medals and two Silver medals for my academic achievements. I have also been awarded an Appreciation award for my research on "Multipath Mitigation via Satellite Communication for Blind Navigation" from the Institute of Navigation USA and the J R Beard award from the Institute of Engineering & Technology, UK. 

Being an active team player and strategic thinker, I am energetic, organized and determined to achieve my targets. I have proven negotiation and liaison experience with a range of different customers using sound communication and well-developed inter-personnel skills. My administrative and academic background demonstrates a successful record of career accomplishments. Through these achievements, I have proved myself a strong motivator and demonstrated professional qualities in technical and management areas.

I am Programme Evaluator (PEV) of Computer Systems Engineering and Software Engineering programmes on behalf of Pakistan Engineering Council (PEC) and National Technology Council (NTC). I am also a member of EAB (Engineering Accreditation Board) of PEC. I have also attended ABET Accreditation Assessment Workshop and Symposium in Portland, Oregon, USA in April 2013 and Washington Accord meeting in Penang Malaysia in April 2014. I am also a member of Syndicate of Begum Nusrat Bhutto (BNB) Women University Sukkur, Indus University Karachi and Barrette Hodgson University Karachi, Shah Abdul Latif University (SALU) Khairpur Mirs and Aror University of Art, Architecture, Design and Heritage, Sukkur, Academic Council of QUEST, Nawab shah and Selection Board of SALU Khairpur and Sukkur IBA University, Sukkur. I am also an external examiner of PhD programmes of Hamdard University and COMSATS Islamabad.

At Present, I am working as a Professor in Sukkur IBA University Sukkur since 09th March 2022. During my tenure of VC of BBSUTSD Khairpur Mirs, I secured NOC from HEC Islamabad, established liaison and achieved green signal from National Technology Council (NTC) to start Engineering Technology programmes, got approved PC-1 of the University from Central Development Working Party (CDWP), Government of Pakistan for joint University Development Project. I also acquired 28 acres additional land for construction of new infrastructure of the University from Revenue Department of Khairpur Mirs, Government of Sindh and completed boundary wall and started the construction of new campus. I also launched the new website and prospectus of the University for both Under-graduate Engineering Technology and Skill Development sections. I also completed the process of handover/takeover of assets, liabilities and staff with Sindh TEVTA.

Being the pioneer Vice Chancellor, I took the challenges, served without salary and a without any official vehicle for more than 9 months initially and faced & overcome the financial challenges of the University. I understand quite well that I have to face further challenges to lead one of the most renowned University if given a chance in a more competitive and difficult economic environment, maintain the sound financial base, develop and refurbish the infrastructure and provide the best possible environment to recruit and retain the academic and administrative staff. I also have to establish close contacts with industry and form an active industry-academia board for the employment and placement of the graduates. However this cannot be one-man operation, so I have to form a well-equipped and multi-skilled team to get the esteemed institution moving on the path of success.  

I am the first academician who achieved the status of Professor under the mentorship of Late Prof. Nisar Ahmed Siddiqui in Sukkur IBA University and established the faculty of Engineering and laboratories under the kind guidance of legend Nisar Ahmed Siddiqui.

Prof. Dr. Irfan Ahmed Rind.biography:
‘Glory after every fall’ might be the best expression to define my to-date and future achievements. Enthusiasm, excitement, passion, commitment, and most importantly optimism are the qualities in keeping the above expression alive. The journey started in 2000 when refused admission to a medical university— a shattered dream to have the title of ‘Dr.’ in front of my name to live the expectations of my parents. Became Dr. anyway after securing first positions in B.A and M.A English literature in 2005 from the University of Sindh, Jamshoro Pakistan; becoming one of four applicants from all over Pakistan to secure the best scholarship of HEC in 2007; getting M.A in Applied Linguistics and Ph.D. in Education from the University of Sussex, UK in 2008 and 2012 respectively. Such successes brought humbleness and modesty and; at the same time increased the level of enthusiasm and commitment to continue the same chain of success in research and teaching. Thus, I continued my quest for knowledge and went to Harvard University in 2016 for post-doctorate certification in 'Mindfulness of Educator", and later went to Teachers College Columbia University, USA in 2019 for a post-doctorate in "Critical Thinking".   
I believe that individual success is strongly associated with the institution success in which one studies/works. Thus, efforts should always be made in developing and promoting the home institution. It was done for the University of Sindh by making it the focus of my Ph.D. thesis; the same was done for the University of Sussex by promoting it worldwide as an international student ambassador and representing it in different forums as a researcher. And now all efforts are put together to promote and enhance the Department of Education at Sukkur IBA University.

2.institute: Harvard Graduate School of Education, USA

Dr. Syed Tasadaque A. Shah.biography:
Dr Tasadaque has 24 years of experience; he is highly skilled, problem solving teacher and a synthetic organic and medicinal chemist and an administrator. He got BSc from SALU Khairpur, MSc from QAU Islamabad, and achieved DAAD Scholarship in year 2000 from Germany and he achieved PhD in 2003 from the University of Tuebingen Germany with “Magna Cum Laude” means “with great honor”, under the supervision of Prof. Wolfgang Voelter. Prof. Voelter was Pakistan’s great supporter, the government of Pakistan acknowledged his services by awarding him two highest civil awards, Hilal-i-Pakistan and Sitara-i-Pakistan and a research complex at Karachi University is named after him. https://www.dawn.com/news/1238921
Dr Tasadaque worked seven years at School of Pharmacy and School of Biochemistry at Trinity College Dublin and is author and co-author of more than 49 peer-reviewed publications such as two Nature (IF 50), a Science (IF 47) and a Cell Metabolism (IF 27) etc., total Impact Factor approximately 290 and Citation Factor around, 5600 on Google Scholar and around 4650 https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Syed_Shah108, and in web of Science (Publons) is around 10000 https://publons.com/researcher/4168994/syed-tasadaque-ali-shah/ (visible with login). He presented his novel research work in national and international conferences worldwide. Due to his extraordinary research work, he is one of the topmost cited and impact factor Sindhi Scientist.
Most interestingly in 2004, he developed an efficient method for the synthesis of peptide aldehyde libraries employed in the discovery of reversible SARS corona virus main protease inhibitors. These compounds can be treated as a potent drug against the harmful disease such as severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) corona virus COVID19. These results are published in ChemBioChem 2006 see publications list below.
One most important example of his publications as a co-author is “Beta-2 adrenergic receptor-Gs protein complex” published in Nature in 2011 with Nobel Laureate Prof Brian Kobilka, this publication played a crucial role in the Contribution in Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 2012. Contribution of Dr Tasadaque to this extraordinary work was recognized by Prof Brian Kobilka in his Nobel Prize award lecture. 
https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/chemistry/2012/kobilka/lecture/ (at 31 minutes).

Dr. Barkat Ali Bhayo.biography:
Dr. Barkat Ali Bhayo was born in district Khaipur Mir’s. He completed his primary education from his
village (Usman Bhayo) and secondary and high school education from High School Piryaloi and Govt.
Comprehensive school Khairpur Mir’s, respectively. Dr. Bhayo studied during 1997-2001 at Shah Abdul
Latif University, and got BSc (Hons) and MSc in mathematics.

In 2007, Dr. Bhayo moved to Finland for higher education, and earned M.Phil and PhD degrees from
University of Turku, Finland, in 2011. The title of his master, M.Phil and PhD theses are “Conformal
invariants”, “Distortion theorems of quasiconformal maps” and “Quasiconformal mappings and
inequalities involving special functions”, respectively. He is also having Master in Teacher Education and
Teaching Pedagogy from University of Helsinki, Finland.

Dr. Bhayo is having around  twenty years of research, teaching and administration more than sixteen years research and teaching and administration and
conducting teacher training at different universities of the world, i.e., University of turku (Finland),
University of Jyväskylä (Finland), University of Turku (Finland), Quaid-e-Awam University
(Pakistan), Salpaus Further Education (Finland), Southwest University (China), Sabanci University
(Turkey), Tohoku University (Japan),and Sukkur IBA University (Pakistan).

Dr. Bhayo is working as a Professor in mathematics and Campus director at Sukkur IBA University-
Kandhkot Campus. So far Dr. Bhayo has published 32 research papers in international journals, i.e., Transactions of
American Mathematical Society, Edinburg mathematical society, Journal of Mathematical Analysis and
Applications, Journal of Approximation Theory, Mathematical Inequalities and Applications, Journal of
Mathematical Inequalities, and so on.

Dr. Bhayo is multi-subject specialist, competent and responsible faculty member of the Sukkur IBA
University.

He won various awards during his Ph.D. from BJUT that includes, Special Contribution Award in curricular and extracurricular activities at BJUT from the Beijing Government in 2019, the Outstanding Researcher Award (Ph.D.) from the Ministry of Education and Chinese Scholarship Council of China in 2019, Outstanding Graduate Award (Ph.D.) from Beijing University of Technology China, Won Certificate of Appreciation from Embassy of Pakistan in Beijing (Ph.D.) in 2019 in regard of my outstanding academics and research performance, and etc.  He is the author of above 50+ publications. His research findings are published in tier-I impact factor journals. These journals are categorized in the "W Category" by Higher Education Commission, Pakistan. He also chaired two international conferences and is an active reviewer of various SCI/SCIE journals. His area of research is Machine Learning, Feature Engineering, Data Science, text classification, Image Classification, Digital Image Processing, Natural Language Processing, Deep Learning, Computer Networks, Network Security, and online Social networking.

Prof. Dr. M. Abdul Rehman.biography:
With over 25 years of extensive experience of teaching, research, development, and administration in the field of academia, I am dedicated to the pursuit of excellence in education, research, and academic management.  Throughout my career, I have held various leadership positions and contributed significantly to the growth and development of educational landscape at Department, Campus, and University levels.
My diverse portfolio includes roles as a Pro Vice Chancellor (Sub Campuses of Sukkur IBA University), Dean Faculty of Science and Information Technology (Sukkur IBA University), Director Campus (Sukkur IBA University Khairpur Campus), Head of Computer Science Department (Sukkur IBA University), Professor of Computer Science (Sukkur IBA University), and Research Associate at Bayreuth University Germany. I have published 34 research papers in national/international journals as well as presented my research work at various well-known international/national conferences.
In addition to my experience and leadership roles in academia, I have also played a pivotal role in leading innovative initiatives and infrastructure development within the education sector. Notably, I have been involved in establishing Pakistan's first-ever Digital Fabrication Laboratory (FAB LAB), an innovative facility that has revolutionized the way students engage with technology and fostered a culture of hands-on learning. With the support of Rs. 84 million from the Sindh Government and technical assistance from the FAB Foundation at MIT in Boston, USA, I successfully initiated and established the Digital Fabrication Laboratory. This state-of-the-art facility provides students with access to advanced technologies and equipment, enabling them to explore the realms of digital design, prototyping, and fabrication.
Moreover, under my leadership, another FAB Lab was established at Sukkur IBA University's main campus, with a financial grant of Rs. 87 million from the Higher Education Commission (HEC) of Pakistan.
Furthermore, I have made significant contributions to the expansion and development of Sukkur IBA University through the establishment of the Khairpur Campus and its sub-centres in each taluka of the Khairpur District. Starting from the initial proposal development, preparation of the PC-I, and overseeing the construction of the campus, I played a leading role in ensuring the successful deployment of the new educational facilities. This expansion has not only increased access to quality education for students in the region but has also generated opportunities for academic and economic growth.
I have also played a pivotal role in establishing the Office of Research, Innovation, and Commercialization (ORIC) at Sukkur IBA University. From the initial stages of developing the proposal to the final deployment of the office, I have been actively involved in every step of the process. I diligently prepared the necessary documents, corresponded with the Higher Education Commission (HEC), and effectively managed local resources to ensure the successful establishment of the office.
I have also actively participated as a member of several University and national-level bodies.
As a member of the University Senate, Syndicate, Academic and Faculty Councils, and the Board of Advanced Studies and Research (BASR), I have played an essential role in shaping policies, approving academic programs, and ensuring adherence to quality standards. My involvement in these bodies has provided me with a comprehensive understanding of the governance structure of higher education institutions, as well as the challenges and opportunities involved in strategic decision-making. My participation as a senior member of the HEC-NCEAC Accreditation Committee showcases my commitment to upholding academic standards and ensuring the quality of education.
Through these diverse roles, I have gained valuable insights into the administrative, academic, and regulatory aspects of the higher education sector. My participation in these bodies has equipped me with a broad perspective and a deep understanding of the challenges and opportunities in higher education governance and quality assurance.
In my role as Pro Vice Chancellor (PVC) for Sub-Campuses at Sukkur IBA University, I am responsible for the strategic planning and development of each sub-campus, ensuring alignment with the university’s mission, vision, and academic objectives. I also lead expansion efforts, including the introduction of new campuses, academic departments as well as programs, recruitment of faculty, and enhancement of campus facilities to address the needs of each campus’s student body. Moreover, I manage budgets, resources, and infrastructure to ensure efficient campus operations and optimized resource allocation. 
Prior to my role as PVC, I served as Dean Faculty of Science and Information Technology, Sukkur IBA University. In this capacity, I provided strategic leadership in curriculum development, research initiatives, and academic policies within the faculty, ensuring academic programs meet accreditation standards, industry demands, and are aligned with the institution's mission.
As the Director Campus (Sukkur IBA University Khairpur Campus), I successfully oversaw the overall administration and management of the campus, ensuring smooth operations and fostering an environment conducive to learning. During my tenure, I implemented innovative strategies and policies that enhanced student engagement, faculty collaboration, and academic excellence.
As the Head of Computer Science Department, Sukkur IBA, I led a team of dedicated educators, overseeing curriculum development, assessment strategies, and instructional methodologies. I utilized my administrative expertise in managing departmental activities like curriculum development, program accreditation (NCEAC and ABET), teacher training and evaluations and quality assurance.
As a Professor, I dedicated several years to imparting knowledge and mentoring students, inspiring them to reach their full potential. As an Associate Professor, I engaged in advanced research and collaborated with colleagues to publish scholarly work of significant impact.
Additionally, my experience as a Research Associate at Department of Computer Science, University of Bayreuth, Germany for 4 years allowed me to contribute to the advancement of knowledge in my field through rigorous research and publication of peer-reviewed articles.

Prof. Dr. Engr. Zahid Hussain Khand.biography:
Dr.Khand has thirty (30) years of teaching and administration experience at the university level. Dr. Khand is a motivated and dedicated academician with a proven record of management and Human Resource Development. Before joining the Sukkur IBA University in the year 2001, Dr. Khand worked at Siemens Pakistan Pvt. limited, the Mehran University College of Engineering and Technology, Nawabshah and Quaid-E-Awam University Engineering Sciences and Technology; Nawabshah Dr. Khand holds the degree Doctor of education in higher education management from University of Liverpool, UK. Dr. Khand holds the degree of M.Sc, Software Development from the University of Huddersfield, UK, and Bachelor of Engineering (Electrical Engineering) from Mehran University of Engineering and Technology, Jamshoro. His strengths are project preparation, project planning, and management, Green office initiatives, Strategic planning, and Software Development. 
The SIBA Testing Services (STS) is the brainchild of the Dr. Khand, which has gained reputation toward meritorious recruitment process in the Government departments. He is a member of various professional organizations like IEEE, ACM, and PEC. He is the author and co-author of several research articles published in reputable research journals. He has been associated with Sukkur BA University since last 21 years.

4.institute: Mehran University of Engineering and Technology

Prof. Dr. Sher Muhammad Daudpota.biography:
I currently hold the position of Professor of Computer Science and serve as the Director of Postgraduate Studies at Sukkur IBA University. My academic responsibilities encompass teaching a wide array of subjects, including Data Science, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Natural Language Processing, and Artificial Intelligence (AI), along with programming courses, both at the undergraduate and postgraduate levels. My research and publications primarily revolve around these AI domains. I am a founding member of the deep-nlp.net research group, dedicated to advancing the field of natural language processing. Our research group has made significant contributions, resulting in multiple impactful journal publications and successful collaborations that secured funding for higher education initiatives.

Moreover, I am currently entrusted with the role of Project Manager for the NORPART-CONNECT (https://norpart-connect.com/) initiative, a prestigious five-year partnership spanning from 2022 to 2026, between Sukkur IBA University and NTNU Norway. This initiative is aimed at developing curriculum for MS in applied computer science degree program. I am also serving as a Researcher on another collaboration project named RAPID (http://erasmuscbhe-rapid.com/). It is a collaboration of ten partners from Pakistan and Europe to increase Pakistani faculty capacity in online education. RAPID is funded by European Commission under Erasmus+ CBHE program.  I've also played a pivotal role in a five-year collaboration between Sukkur IBA, Johnson County Community College, and the University of Missouri Kansas City (UMKC) from 2014 to 2019. Serving as the Project Director for this partnership, I guided the Sukkur IBA faculty in embracing best practices in Assessment, Distance Education, Early Childhood Education, Mathematics, and English. The most enduring outcomes of this partnership include the improved faculty capacity in these areas and the establishment of Learning Centers at Sukkur IBA University, catering to students with diverse educational needs. Furthermore, my consultancy work with the USWDP of USAID provided me with invaluable insights into the community college model in Kabul and its role in workforce development. I collaborated with KPU faculty in Kabul to develop and evaluate an Associate Degree program in computer science.

My multifaceted role at Sukkur IBA has also involved me in the development of numerous funding proposals for corporate and government initiatives. One notable example is my partnership with OGDCL on the National Talent Hunt Program (NTHP). Through this collaboration, Sukkur IBA, with support from OGDCL Ltd, identifies and selects 75 students from each province of Pakistan. These students are enrolled in an innovative "zero semester" program, designed to strengthen their English, ICT, and Mathematics skills, thereby preparing them for higher education. The project's overarching goal is to bridge the rural-urban divide, ensuring inclusive access to higher education. I proudly serve as the Project Director for OGDC NTHP, and to date, over 1500 students have benefited from this partnership, with more than 400 graduates who have completed their bachelor's degrees on fully funded scholarships. Many of these graduates are now contributing to the job market, launching their own startups, or pursuing advanced degrees, such as Masters or PhDs.
